Bcc: 
Date: Mon, 16 May 2005 14:53:09 -0700
Mime-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; format=flowed
X-OriginalArrivalTime: 16 May 2005 21:53:09.0451 (UTC) FILETIME=[A612E1B0:01C55A61]
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: [sfraves] nrr: SQUISH!

I was doing a search on "tomato worms" and this is what came up...I had no 
idea this was even a part of life for some....
life gets better and better...
Danny P

I guess

by G.A. Pearson
Department of Entomology, Box 7626
North Carolina State University
Raleigh, NC 27695-7626.


For the past two years, I've been working on a project documenting insect 
tatoos, scarification, and other forms of body art involving insects 
(Pearson 1995). In the course of this investigation, I've met some highly 
interesting people not usually encountered on the average State University 
campus. Somehow, through a strange series of events that probably don't bear 
any further examination, I came in contact with Jeff Vilencia, publisher of 
The American Journal of The Crush Freaks. Vilencia describes the crush 
fetish as a variant of giantessophilism:

"The feeling is that of letting go, powerless, helpless, tiny, small, and 
buglike. Wanting to see a female crush something with her foot, longing to 
be a helpless insect as you squirm around under her foot sole as she 
squishes your body into grease."
Insects become a fetish object for the crush freak, who wishes to be an 
insect ground underfoot. Witnessing or imagining the act of a woman crushing 
an insect is sexually arousing. The bigger the foot the better; shoe size 9 
and up are preferred. (My puny size 6 feet made me feel safe enough to 
discuss his obsession with Vilencia.)

The AJCF has 500 subscribers, mostly in America but also a few from around 
the world. Inside is Vilencia's collection of letters from fellow crush 
fetishists, book reviews, and miscellaneous crush erotica. Two other 
magazines cater to crush freaks: Squish! and In Step, a foot fetish 
magazine.

There is a flourishing industry in underground videotapes, some of which are 
highly produced numbers that have been exhibited at film festivals. A 
casting call for one of Vilencia's "crush" films is reproduced in Figure 1. 
Amazingly, Vilencia seems to have been inundated by hopeful actresses 
willing to trample for film fame, some of whom even bought their own bugs 
and snails to the audition. The films themselves are enough to make an 
entomologist weep:


"Squish Playhouse #3: Starring Debbie The Crush Queen And Co-Starring Dozens 
of Crickets and Mealworms."

"Squish Playhouse #5: Featuring a Special Guest Victim -- A Tarantula 
Spider!!!"
The other victims in Playhouse #5 are live pinkies (baby mice). Well, were 
live pinkies.

Vilencia sent me a copy of his award winning video "Smush!" and I watched it 
with a few entomological friends. It didn't do much for us besides gross us 
out. That is also the reaction of the actress in the film, as she mashes 
earthworms to death, first in bare feet and then in black pumps, grinning 
maniacally. "Eewwww, I'm stepping on yewwwww..." she squeals in an 
artificially-engineered baby-doll voice. The disgust of the stomper 
heightens the excitement of the crush freak, according to Vilencia. Crush 
freaks watch the film and -- I have to say it -- mastur-bait. The film won 
an award at the Toronto Film Festival, where a few animal rights activists 
wanted to know "When does cruelty to earthworms become art?"

Audio tapes are also offered. One entitled "A Housewife's Guide to Squishing 
Bugs" has the following blurb:


"Spiders, Ants, Silverfish ,Cockroaches, Snails, Slugs, and Fat Tomato Worms 
are no match for this angry housewife with her sexy size 10 feet! Follow her 
from kitchen to garden as she steps on her victims with no mercy! You will 
want to be the next insect under her foot!"
A "crush mistress," Ms. J, is a professional dominatrix, making specialized 
videos and tapes for different clients. In an interview in the AJCF she 
says:


"50% of the people who write to me are into the "Crush" fetish. But of the 
people who have maintained an ongoing relationship with me, probably only 
15%. (are actually crush freaks)"
When asked if she feels any remorse squishing the bugs, she laughs and says:


"None, none! There's no remorse 'cause they're little bugs, I mean, what is 
their use?" ... I mean, I can appreciate life being sacred, but bugs have no 
minds you know, and no feelings..."
Interviewer: Is there anything you won't step on?
"As far as bugs go, I do not step on the little spindly-legged spiders, 
cause they're my friends. But when it comes to bugs, I mean they're just 
icky little creatures si I can't think why they shouldn't be stepped on!"
Another woman named Kathy in Utah offers audio and videotapes to crush 
freaks. One called "Teacher's Pet" is described as:


"A tall stiletto-heeled teacher keeps two students after school for bringing 
their pet beetle to class. To teach them a lesson, she steps on the beetle 
and crushes it right in front of them..."
This particular tape echoes Vilencia's theory of how crush fetishism 
develops:


"When it comes to the crush, several things come to mind... including the 
Oedipus complex, because certainly we have seen our mothers kill insects and 
other people kill insects, and I think that the gigantess imagery that seems 
to be predominant in more people than one would imagine, also come from 
childhood. Somewhere there was a sexual connection from seeing all the women 
in heels and hose while very small ourselves..."
Some of the books reviewed by the AJCF are rather surprising: Kafka's 
Metamorphosis is to be expected, but the rest of the reviews were general 
interest entomology books. Bug Busters (1991) and Bugs, Slugs, and Other 
Things (1991) were reviewed, complete with page numbers to bug crushing 
references. Vilencia has also edited and republished foot-fetish excerpts of 
R. Von Ebbling's Psychopathia Sexualis, an 1886 treatise.

Clearly, I just don't get the whole crush predilection. However, there seems 
to be very few crush freaks, so I don't think the invertebrate world is in 
great danger. Crush fetishists represent a fascinating example of the human 
ability to eroticize just about any activity: in this case, one of interest 
to entomologists.

The next time you stomp a bug, better look around -- Jeff and his friends 
might be watching:


"I think its completely harmless, because it's a fantasy and we can't really 
experience this (being crushed underfoot). We can do it only in our minds 
and I think it's probably one of the more safer things. As far as people who 
are into crushing insects or seeing it done, I don't see anything more wrong 
with that than going into a supermarket and going into the Raid section, 
because human beings hate insects."


--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Acknowledgements

I thank Jeff Vilencia, editor of The American Journal of The Crush Freaks 
for his free sharing of materials on the crush fetish and fascinating 
conversations. My use of the term "crush freak" is mot meant to disparage; 
it is used by fetishists as a self-description.

Bibliography


Pearson, G.A. 1995. Insect tattoos on humans: a "dermagraphic" study. 
American Entomologist.

Fig. 1. A Casting call for Squish, a film by Jeff Vilencia.

Fig. 2. Some of the film promotional material.






"What I am against is quotas. I am against hard quotas, quotas they 
basically delineate based upon whatever. However they delineate, quotas, I 
think, vulcanize society. So I don't know how that fits into what everybody 
else is saying, their relative positions, but that's my position." George W. 
Bush (our president)

AIM --->spiffythewarrior

http://search.msn.click-url.com/go/onm00200636ave/direct/01/

attractive girl stepping on crabs in a pan- and I thought "WTF is this?   
Are people really in to this?  *Why* was this video made?"
I couldn't tell if it had any sexual connotation to it or if it was just  
some random video, but apparently it's the former.
I suspect that in addition to the gigantism hook, it also triggers the  
same things as the girls-stepping/sitting-on-balloons thing...

God bless the Internet (TM)

Waddup Stuck Up Bubble Butts....j/k

sunset was off the hook, it was sweet...it was bad
ass...

i had a blast, the vibe was sooooooo blissful...

i danced and danced and danced...n danced :p

the funny thing..this time i drove to sunset with no
designated driver..i don't drink and drive..so i was
hella sober for the entire thing, it was a different
view...kinda hilarious actually...

saw a few peeps from previous sunsets, it was nice
seeing molly and friends again sat with her for awhile
talked, caught up on life as i waited for karina :p

i took some pics of my surroundings, let see where did
i put my camera again..

i finally met Karina, YAY!!! We had killer fun..
we need to hook up again chick..
i met a bunch of new people, thanks karina for the
intros...

so who else was there besides danny....btw danny..ur
on my aim..mr spiffy..i was wondering who was
that...so try me again on yahoo..whats your sn on
there...so i wont deny you...lol..

okie dokie pokies...

i'm gonna get back on typing my final...

Peace, Love and Soooooul....Train! 

xoxoxoxoxo
adriana

Dope... All the MCs, MC Duh, Lindzee, Colonel, but on 4 real though, the
set that did it 4 me was Qzen... I mean.. she spun my fave kinda Jungle &
it was like the hard dubby shit.,.... I Loved it!!

Andy Weatherall was Sick.. I remember he closed out the main room... like
I do remember he spun alota old school breaks.. like musically i mean....
those records coulda came like last year.. LoL... but it was Dope.... I
left the Jungle room a few times 'cuase oooh.. i couldn't get enough of it
man... Danced so hard on the floor!

The same thing w/ Keith Tennis Wood.. Like i remember being in the smoking
alley like havin' a cig & looking @ the dance floor then this song came
on.. lke this almost proggy beat that was just so yummy!!!  I ran through
2 other rooms & 3 stair ways 2 get down there.. ooh my gosh... I was
dangin s hard.. YUM!!!

I met them later after the main rom closed down & we were like hangin' out
w/ the promoters & stuff.. LoL.. OK.. so like in 20 minutes, Andrew
Weatherhall like explained to me the evolution of Elecronic Music circa
1988 - Present while incorporating the origins of the rave scene, the
clubs the did them in, the people involved, & the drugs people did.. LoL..
it was a Dope conversatoin... LoL.. he even said that I was on his
Guestlist like whenever i end up in London & it's a Sat Night... LMAO....
How funny!!!

Diplo went on in the front room @ around 3AM I guess.. he was late & I
didn't know he was there... so i kinda missed his set... but in the front
room.. there was this Dj who played 80s muzic & missed it w/ house...  it
was Sick.. Aha & Pat Benitar!!  eeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeehyayaya!!!

It was just a really fun time man... I danced sooooooo much that night.. i
swear i lost 10 pounds!

Oh yeah.. it was also CooL.. there was an art installation thingie @ teh
club was pretty Dope.. like there was this toilet paper thing in the VIP
room, along w/ a TV video thingie of a nipple & a mouth.. then there was
porn...I called the basement like the inside of the body 'cause there was
like red blod cell shapes hangin' from the ceiling...

It was a very Groovy Night!  Wish i saw more of U there =)  Next time!


-- 
Take Care <3
Peace=->Jus' Me =-> O§bY {8O)

from suck an Awesome night... I mean..i was kinda buggin' about takin'
bart home & stuff.. but I had a smile the whole time!

Subject: [sfraves] Weekend in Review....FnF, Sunset, Cocomo

yo.
so saturday night was filled with work at the jazz joint, came back to the 
house to pick up my good buddy Jessee and housemade bud Mindy (hi babe) and 
headed over to FnF.  I was nervous about how loud ethe music was outside but 
also very excited  ;)
Showed up durring the end of Micron's set (you go Gurl)  Mad respect to Dom 
who made me want to...well, um....
anyways, the music was great, I only had a little time to play around before 
working the door shift.  Sorry if I was totally annoying with checking 
stamps...I would have much rather made out with everyone there...trust me. 
AndyW, thanks for the "meanguy lessons" and for being you.  It was great 
re-introducing myself to sooo many people I have met before sooo many times.
The lighting was amazing!!!
The vibe was off the hook!
Very diverse crowd, but everyone was super chill and lovely...so many old 
friends I have not seen in a while...
I love you all  :)
Thanks Phillip for coming out too, that was a lovely morning surprise...Oh, 
and who ever drank the last of my whiskey...you owe me ;)
Glad to be a part of FnF  always...
  soooo, we get home around 9:30isham sleep for an hour, friends showed up 
and woke us all and we headed out to Sunset.
There  was one guy on the dancefloor when we arrived, got rockstar parking 
and got to watch my friends lil boy (3 yrs old) do some breakdancing...was 
awesome Love ya Tai!
It was great being there so early and just seeing the place fill 
up..glorious, wonderful house as always, damn I was tired.  but could not 
stop shaking my ass.  BAM and I are going to start a company, if anyone is 
interested in 'Assjam' drop me a line, or you can ask him for details which 
I am sure he would love.  I was the guy  with the  shirt that said "Trust 
me, I am a doctor" with squished strawberries all over my ass...don't ask...
Great to see quite a few peeps from FnF out there, Erik Giling, thanks for 
the wine :)
Bam, my "horsie lips" are only for you baby Eesiad, very lovely to meet you 
darlin...

around 6:30, we headed to Cocomo for the benefit...
Music music music, loved the outside area much better than inside  and they 
closed it down much earlier than I expected.  EllenFerrato rocked it, Much 
respect to all the peeps who helped organize this amazing line up of dj's, I 
was thoroughly impressed.
4th wind came with shots of tequila (thank god!)  I was able to 
maintain...then all my good ol' pal's from Teatro Zinzanni showed up and fed 
me more booze...
all of a sudden I can't remember much more...all I know is that we all live 
in a very special place and I hope no one takes it for granted.  The 
community in SF is amazing...I am very greatful of all of yuz..."and I am 
not just saying that because of the drugs"  didn't do any, yay!
I saw some, then I stepped on them, because they tried attacking my 
feet...that didn't do shit, they just got pissed and busted out the 
accordian and playing "its a small world after all"
so I went home and finally got some rest.
lots of wondeful memories to dwell on...I had better do it quick cause they 
only last about a day or two  ;)

Be well everyone...
Danny




"What I am against is quotas. I am against hard quotas, quotas they 
basically delineate based upon whatever. However they delineate, quotas, I 
think, vulcanize society. So I don't know how that fits into what everybody 
else is saying, their relative positions, but that's my position." George W. 
Bush (our president)

>>Raleigh, NC 27695-7626.
>>
>>
>>For the past two years, I've been working on a project documenting  insect 
>>tatoos, scarification, and other forms of body art involving  insects 
>>(Pearson 1995). In the course of this investigation, I've met  some highly 
>>interesting people not usually encountered on the average  State 
>>University campus. Somehow, through a strange series of events  that 
>>probably don't bear any further examination, I came in contact with  Jeff 
>>Vilencia, publisher of The American Journal of The Crush Freaks.  Vilencia 
>>describes the crush fetish as a variant of giantessophilism:
>>
>>"The feeling is that of letting go, powerless, helpless, tiny, small,  and 
>>buglike. Wanting to see a female crush something with her foot,  longing 
>>to be a helpless insect as you squirm around under her foot sole  as she 
>>squishes your body into grease."
>>Insects become a fetish object for the crush freak, who wishes to be an  
>>insect ground underfoot. Witnessing or imagining the act of a woman  
>>crushing an insect is sexually arousing. The bigger the foot the better;  
>>shoe size 9 and up are preferred. (My puny size 6 feet made me feel safe  
>>enough to discuss his obsession with Vilencia.)
>>
>>The AJCF has 500 subscribers, mostly in America but also a few from  
>>around the world. Inside is Vilencia's collection of letters from fellow  
>>crush fetishists, book reviews, and miscellaneous crush erotica. Two  
>>other magazines cater to crush freaks: Squish! and In Step, a foot  fetish 
>>magazine.
>>
>>There is a flourishing industry in underground videotapes, some of which  
>>are highly produced numbers that have been exhibited at film festivals.  A 
>>casting call for one of Vilencia's "crush" films is reproduced in  Figure 
>>1. Amazingly, Vilencia seems to have been inundated by hopeful  actresses 
>>willing to trample for film fame, some of whom even bought  their own bugs 
>>and snails to the audition. The films themselves are  enough to make an 
>>entomologist weep:
>>
>>
>>"Squish Playhouse #3: Starring Debbie The Crush Queen And Co-Starring  
>>Dozens of Crickets and Mealworms."
>>
>>"Squish Playhouse #5: Featuring a Special Guest Victim -- A Tarantula  
>>Spider!!!"
>>The other victims in Playhouse #5 are live pinkies (baby mice). Well,  
>>were live pinkies.
>>
>>Vilencia sent me a copy of his award winning video "Smush!" and I  watched 
>>it with a few entomological friends. It didn't do much for us  besides 
>>gross us out. That is also the reaction of the actress in the  film, as 
>>she mashes earthworms to death, first in bare feet and then in  black 
>>pumps, grinning maniacally. "Eewwww, I'm stepping on yewwwww..."  she 
>>squeals in an artificially-engineered baby-doll voice. The disgust  of the 
>>stomper heightens the excitement of the crush freak, according to  
>>Vilencia. Crush freaks watch the film and -- I have to say it --  
>>mastur-bait. The film won an award at the Toronto Film Festival, where a  
>>few animal rights activists wanted to know "When does cruelty to  
>>earthworms become art?"
>>
>>Audio tapes are also offered. One entitled "A Housewife's Guide to  
>>Squishing Bugs" has the following blurb:
>>
>>
>>"Spiders, Ants, Silverfish ,Cockroaches, Snails, Slugs, and Fat Tomato  
>>Worms are no match for this angry housewife with her sexy size 10 feet!  
>>Follow her from kitchen to garden as she steps on her victims with no  
>>mercy! You will want to be the next insect under her foot!"
>>A "crush mistress," Ms. J, is a professional dominatrix, making  
>>specialized videos and tapes for different clients. In an interview in  
>>the AJCF she says:
>>
>>
>>"50% of the people who write to me are into the "Crush" fetish. But of  
>>the people who have maintained an ongoing relationship with me, probably  
>>only 15%. (are actually crush freaks)"
>>When asked if she feels any remorse squishing the bugs, she laughs and  
>>says:
>>
>>
>>"None, none! There's no remorse 'cause they're little bugs, I mean, what  
>>is their use?" ... I mean, I can appreciate life being sacred, but bugs  
>>have no minds you know, and no feelings..."
>>Interviewer: Is there anything you won't step on?
>>"As far as bugs go, I do not step on the little spindly-legged spiders,  
>>cause they're my friends. But when it comes to bugs, I mean they're just  
>>icky little creatures si I can't think why they shouldn't be stepped on!"
>>Another woman named Kathy in Utah offers audio and videotapes to crush  
>>freaks. One called "Teacher's Pet" is described as:
>>
>>
>>"A tall stiletto-heeled teacher keeps two students after school for  
>>bringing their pet beetle to class. To teach them a lesson, she steps on  
>>the beetle and crushes it right in front of them..."
>>This particular tape echoes Vilencia's theory of how crush fetishism  
>>develops:
>>
>>
>>"When it comes to the crush, several things come to mind... including  the 
>>Oedipus complex, because certainly we have seen our mothers kill  insects 
>>and other people kill insects, and I think that the gigantess  imagery 
>>that seems to be predominant in more people than one would  imagine, also 
>>come from childhood. Somewhere there was a sexual  connection from seeing 
>>all the women in heels and hose while very small  ourselves..."
>>Some of the books reviewed by the AJCF are rather surprising: Kafka's  
>>Metamorphosis is to be expected, but the rest of the reviews were  general 
>>interest entomology books. Bug Busters (1991) and Bugs, Slugs,  and Other 
>>Things (1991) were reviewed, complete with page numbers to bug  crushing 
>>references. Vilencia has also edited and republished  foot-fetish excerpts 
>>of R. Von Ebbling's Psychopathia Sexualis, an 1886  treatise.
>>
>>Clearly, I just don't get the whole crush predilection. However, there  
>>seems to be very few crush freaks, so I don't think the invertebrate  
>>world is in great danger. Crush fetishists represent a fascinating  
>>example of the human ability to eroticize just about any activity: in  
>>this case, one of interest to entomologists.
>>
>>The next time you stomp a bug, better look around -- Jeff and his  friends 
>>might be watching:
>>
>>
>>"I think its completely harmless, because it's a fantasy and we can't  
>>really experience this (being crushed underfoot). We can do it only in  
>>our minds and I think it's probably one of the more safer things. As far  
>>as people who are into crushing insects or seeing it done, I don't see  
>>anything more wrong with that than going into a supermarket and going  
>>into the Raid section, because human beings hate insects."
>>
>>
>>--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
>>
>>Acknowledgements
>>
>>I thank Jeff Vilencia, editor of The American Journal of The Crush  Freaks 
>>for his free sharing of materials on the crush fetish and  fascinating 
>>conversations. My use of the term "crush freak" is mot meant  to 
>>disparage; it is used by fetishists as a self-description.
>>
>>Bibliography
>>
>>
>>Pearson, G.A. 1995. Insect tattoos on humans: a "dermagraphic" study.  
>>American Entomologist.
>>
>>Fig. 1. A Casting call for Squish, a film by Jeff Vilencia.
>>
>>Fig. 2. Some of the film promotional material.
>>
>>
>>
>>
>>
>>
>>"What I am against is quotas. I am against hard quotas, quotas they  
>>basically delineate based upon whatever. However they delineate, quotas,  
>>I think, vulcanize society. So I don't know how that fits into what  
>>everybody else is saying, their relative positions, but that's my  
>>position." George W. Bush (our president)
>>
>>AIM --->spiffythewarrior
>>

Subject: [sfraves] NRR: martial arts performance this friday

ok, so this is not rave related.  but my school is doing a large
martial arts performance this friday night at Stanford University.=20
all the info is below.

in addition to our students and my coaches performing some kick ass
wushu and taiji and running around with swords and flying across the
stage...we have a few special guests.

one is Tu Chin-Sheng who practices iron crotch qigong (no joke).  he
is rumored to be able to pull a car with his penis.  no, i'm not
joking.  google his name.

the other is Chiu Chi Ling, a hung ga kungfu master who many of you
will know as "the tailor" in the recent movie, "Kungfu Hustle" with
Stephen Chow.

to get an idea of what wushu is like, here's a little ditty i put
together last year:
7mb version - http://www.jiayo.com/downloads/jiayo_lo.mov
20mb version - http://www.jiayo.com/downloads/jiayo_hi.mov

Tickets are $20 for adults, $10 for kids and Stanford students.

The flyer:
http://www.jiayo.com/night_of_wushu.jpg

Please join us on Friday, May 20th, 2005 at Stanford University for A
Night of Wushu -- a Chinese Martial Arts benefit with all profits
dedicated to the Tsunami relief efforts.

The event will feature many exciting performances, including Drunken
Fist, Ba Gua, Sparring Sets, Tai Ji Quan, and special guests The Gee
Yung Dragon-Lion Dance Association and Qi Gong Master Tu Chin-Sheng.

Details:
Friday, May 20th, 2005
7:30 to 9 pm
Dinkelspiel Auditorium
471 Lagunita Drive
Stanford, CA

Tickets are available starting Monday, April 25th at our San Francisco
location Mondays and Wednesdays 4-9 pm and also through Tiger Claw
Inc:

Tiger Claw Inc.
40740 Encyclopedia circle
Fremont, CA 94538 [map]
Phone: (800) 821-5090
Hours: Mon. - Fri. 9-5 pm, Sat. 10-4 pm=20

Pacific Wushu
San Francisco

San Francisco, CA 94110

>From: Bam <invibe@gmail.com>
>Reply-To: Bam <invibe@gmail.com>
>To: sfraves <sfraves@hyperreal.org>
>Subject: [sfraves] NRR: martial arts performance this friday
>Date: Tue, 17 May 2005 10:58:45 -0700
>
>ok, so this is not rave related.  but my school is doing a large
>martial arts performance this friday night at Stanford University.
>all the info is below.
>
>in addition to our students and my coaches performing some kick ass
>wushu and taiji and running around with swords and flying across the
>stage...we have a few special guests.
>
>one is Tu Chin-Sheng who practices iron crotch qigong (no joke).  he
>is rumored to be able to pull a car with his penis.  no, i'm not
>joking.  google his name.
>
>the other is Chiu Chi Ling, a hung ga kungfu master who many of you
>will know as "the tailor" in the recent movie, "Kungfu Hustle" with
>Stephen Chow.
>
>to get an idea of what wushu is like, here's a little ditty i put
>together last year:
>7mb version - http://www.jiayo.com/downloads/jiayo_lo.mov
>20mb version - http://www.jiayo.com/downloads/jiayo_hi.mov
>
>Tickets are $20 for adults, $10 for kids and Stanford students.
>
>The flyer:
>http://www.jiayo.com/night_of_wushu.jpg
>
>Please join us on Friday, May 20th, 2005 at Stanford University for A
>Night of Wushu -- a Chinese Martial Arts benefit with all profits
>dedicated to the Tsunami relief efforts.
>
>The event will feature many exciting performances, including Drunken
>Fist, Ba Gua, Sparring Sets, Tai Ji Quan, and special guests The Gee
>Yung Dragon-Lion Dance Association and Qi Gong Master Tu Chin-Sheng.
>
>Details:
>Friday, May 20th, 2005
>7:30 to 9 pm
>Dinkelspiel Auditorium
>471 Lagunita Drive
>Stanford, CA
>
>Tickets are available starting Monday, April 25th at our San Francisco
>location Mondays and Wednesdays 4-9 pm and also through Tiger Claw
>Inc:
>
>Tiger Claw Inc.
>40740 Encyclopedia circle
>Fremont, CA 94538 [map]
>Phone: (800) 821-5090
>Hours: Mon. - Fri. 9-5 pm, Sat. 10-4 pm
>
>Pacific Wushu
>San Francisco
># 797 San Jose Avenue
>San Francisco, CA 94110

---------- Forwarded message ----------
Date: Tue, 17 May 2005 14:22:49 -0700 (PDT)
From: ~melyss~ <dj_melyss@yahoo.com>
To: dj_melyss@yahoo.com
Subject: Mayo Grande Finale Tonite

Tonite~The Mayo Grande Finale~Skylark

It is so very bittersweet....

Fours years of troubleshooting sound, backstage nightcaps, wednesday 
morning illin, birthdays, crying in our beers, scandalous flyers, chonky's 
emails, making out in the backroom, crackheads, pancho villa, late night 
visits to cable car pizza, shitty mixers, friends, smiles, laughs, bitchin 
bartenders, and hell...we've even had a few couples have their very first 
dates at skylark (lest you doubt our romantic side) ~and that's just the 
stuff I CAN REMEMBER....

goddamn this party sucked/was the coolest. It makes my heart heavy to 
think that I will be watching Family Feud Reruns on Tuesdays nights from 
now on-but alas-we are pulling the plug while we're still cool-or 
well-that's what we're telling ourselves ;-) Major major props to Chonky T 
for all his freakin hysterical emails, Greg the bartender-who if he didn't 
leave, I may have not have survived another year of Tuesdays, Chad our 
original barmaid, J-fi for coming back and saving me from all the 
testosterone, Tonic, for stepping in and stepping up to alleviate some of 
my psychoness from Chonky, and Matt for being our latest and greatest 
resident. And all you guys-thanks for being great friends. we will be back 
you can count on it.

-Melyss

Mayo @ Skyark-3089 16th St, SF, www.mayonnaisesf.com



------------------------------------------------

~melyss~

www.sistersf.com
www.infinitenrg.com

------------------------------------------------

Court Rules Woman Not Liable in Sex Suit
- By MICHAEL KUNZELMAN, Associated Press Writer
Tuesday, May 17, 2005

(05-17) 15:21 PDT BOSTON, (AP) --

A woman isn't legally responsible for injuries her boyfriend suffered
while they were having consensual sex more than a decade ago, a state
appeals court ruled Monday.

The man, identified only as John Doe in court papers, filed suit
against the woman in 1997, claiming she was negligent when she
suddenly changed positions, landed awkwardly on him and fractured his
penis.

The man underwent emergency surgery in September 1994, "endured a
painful and lengthy recovery" and has suffered from sexual dysfunction
that hasn't responded to medication or counseling, the appeals court
said.

Although the woman may have exposed her boyfriend to "some risk of
harm," the three-judge panel said her conduct during the sexual
encounter wasn't "wanton or reckless" and can't support a lawsuit.

The man's lawsuit already has been thrown out by judges in Salem
District Court and Essex Superior Court.

The appeals court upheld those rulings while noting that its ruling
doesn't apply to cases where someone has negligently infected a
partner with a sexually transmitted disease.

"There are no comprehensive legal rules to regulate consensual sexual
behavior," Justice Joseph Trainor wrote. "In the absence of a
consensus of community values or customs defining normal consensual
conduct, a jury or judge cannot be expected to resolve a claim that
certain consensual sexual conduct is undertaken without reasonable
care."

The man's attorney, John Greenwood, said he is likely to appeal
Monday's ruling to the state's highest court.

"It's a case that hasn't been seen before in Massachusetts," he said.

Greenwood argued that consensual sex doesn't mean "anything goes. ...
The fact that some behavior was agreed to by the parties doesn't mean
all behavior was agreed to by the parties."

The woman's attorney didn't immediately return a telephone call Monday.
--=20

Subject: [sfraves] (nrr) Quote of the Day (Tue)

i ponder posting something profound yet i also dare to tempt fate.  ever
do that?  reading these investing books can make you depressed.  if only i
balanced my checkbook perfectly when i was 20.  when, oh, when is time not
on my side?

then, i say, forget it.  i'm the self-appointed quote of the day guy, the
washed up dj who learned how to write on an internet mailing list laughing
about "coke vs. pepsi" threads (how bout a dr. pepper, young paddywan?)
enough!  i'm going to invent my own quote for once!

and i invite you do the same.  just send it to me privately, and whether i
like it or not i'll post it to the list on one of my quotes.  nothing
derogatory against michael the red stickman (well, try to be nice),
please.

--

if time is not on your side, just make more!

- Deepfog

Subject: [sfraves] BOOYAH!

AMERICANS ARE WIMPS!!!

http://www.timesonline.co.uk/article/0,,3-1616578_1,00.html

"I have met Saddam Hussein exactly the same number of times as Donald
Rumsfeld met him. The difference is Donald Rumsfeld met him to sell
him guns and to give him maps the better to target those guns. I met
him to try and bring about an end to sanctions, suffering and war, and
on the second of the two occasions, I met him to try and persuade him
to let Dr Hans Blix and the United Nations weapons inspectors back
into the country - a rather better use of two meetings with Saddam
Hussein than your own Secretary of State for Defence made of his.

I was an opponent of Saddam Hussein when British and American
governments and businessmen were selling him guns and gas. I used to
demonstrate outside the Iraqi embassy when British and American
officials were going in and doing commerce."

WATCH THIS SHIT ON CNN AND SEE THOSE PUSSY-ASS SCUMBAG CRIMINALS IN
WASHINGTON GET THEIR ASSES REAMED!!!!

I have NEVER been prouder to be British.

Americans are wimps, I'm sorry folks, I'm American too, but I'm less
American than most of you, and I'm damn lucky to be so, because
Americans are WIMPS. You get owned by the corporations every fucking
day and you never do a damn thing to stop it. You never do a damn
thing but wring your fucking hands and whine. Your Democratic Party is
a joke, the whole point is to divert attention and make it seem as if
you're putting up a fight.

THIS is how politics is done. Somebody slings a lie at you, you call
him on his bullshit.

It's that simple.

BOOYAH!!!

You gotta watch this shit on CNN. Anybody who's ever felt any anger
against the US government, tune in to CNN and check out the look on
this British man's face, listen to the tone of this British man's
voice, and let a real man show you how easy it is to make criminal
Washington sleazebags look like the worthless, piddling scum that they
are.

--=20
DJ Soundwave

Bam <invibe@gmail.com> wrote:
ok, so this is not rave related. but my school is doing a large
martial arts performance this friday night at Stanford University. 
all the info is below.

in addition to our students and my coaches performing some kick ass
wushu and taiji and running around with swords and flying across the
stage...we have a few special guests.

one is Tu Chin-Sheng who practices iron crotch qigong (no joke). he
is rumored to be able to pull a car with his penis. no, i'm not
joking. google his name.

the other is Chiu Chi Ling, a hung ga kungfu master who many of you
will know as "the tailor" in the recent movie, "Kungfu Hustle" with
Stephen Chow.

to get an idea of what wushu is like, here's a little ditty i put
together last year:
7mb version - http://www.jiayo.com/downloads/jiayo_lo.mov
20mb version - http://www.jiayo.com/downloads/jiayo_hi.mov

Tickets are $20 for adults, $10 for kids and Stanford students.

The flyer:
http://www.jiayo.com/night_of_wushu.jpg

Please join us on Friday, May 20th, 2005 at Stanford University for A
Night of Wushu -- a Chinese Martial Arts benefit with all profits
dedicated to the Tsunami relief efforts.

The event will feature many exciting performances, including Drunken
Fist, Ba Gua, Sparring Sets, Tai Ji Quan, and special guests The Gee
Yung Dragon-Lion Dance Association and Qi Gong Master Tu Chin-Sheng.

Details:
Friday, May 20th, 2005
7:30 to 9 pm
Dinkelspiel Auditorium
471 Lagunita Drive
Stanford, CA

Tickets are available starting Monday, April 25th at our San Francisco
location Mondays and Wednesdays 4-9 pm and also through Tiger Claw
Inc:

Tiger Claw Inc.
40740 Encyclopedia circle
Fremont, CA 94538 [map]
Phone: (800) 821-5090
Hours: Mon. - Fri. 9-5 pm, Sat. 10-4 pm 

Pacific Wushu
San Francisco
# 797 San Jose Avenue
San Francisco, CA 94110

Subject: [sfraves] NRR: Bad Joke - don't mind my poor taste!

A little boy comes home from school and tells his father that his homework 
assignment is to find out the difference between "potentially" and 
"realistically". "Easy," says his father. "First, ask Mom if she'd sleep 
with the mailman for a million dollars." The boy runs off, then comes back 
and says, "She said yes." "Now go ask your sister the same question." 
advises the father. Again the boy runs off, and again he comes back and 
says, "She said yes." "So, potentially, we're sitting on two million 
dollars," replies the father. "But realistically, we're living with a pair 
of whores."

Subject: [sfraves] BSP: <<<STILLDREAM>>> 5 Year Anniversary Campout - June 17, 18 & 19th, 2005

One month to go!!! Its almost here.

The Stilldream Collective is ready to celebrate their 5 Year Anniversary of
amazing music under the stars.  They have been working hard for the last 6
months to ensure this is going to be the best Stilldream Event of ALL time.
We want you to be there, come be part of the Stilldream Experience!

100% Confirmed Line-Up!!!

The Attack People, LIVE!
www.abiotic.net / Mankind - Minneapolis, MN
It's our pleasure to welcome for the first time At a Stilldream Event, one
of the best and fastest growing acts in the United States. Thick driving
bass meets aggressive percussion. Lush analog sounds creating moody
atmospheres. The music is heavy yet groovy. Contrasting from one extreme to
the other with ease. This is The Attack People. They are the Sound of the
Future!

Dig-Dug
USC Events, Seattle
For over 7 years, DJ Dig-Dug has been a resident DJ for the Northwests
largest electronic music event production company, USC Events. his
underlying themes of warped basslines and intelligent drum loops bring a
sense of unity to his signature sound.   DJ Dig-Dug has developed a
following based on skillsnot hype.   Get Ready!

Treavor
www.Moontribe.org, Sound of Mind - SF
While most DJs are focused on one type of electronica, Treavor is known to
make the barriers between Techno, Trance, House and Breaks seem non-existent
often fusing them into one set. This keeps Treavor one step ahead and allows
him to be able to play any time of the night at any event.  Be Prepared for
the Treavor Experience!

Mystre (www.djmystre.com, Reverb Records - SF)
Dyloot (www.skillsdj.com, Deep Voices - Berkley

Subject: [sfraves] NRR:  SF Hosts World Environment Day (June 1-5)

--=====================_13221912==.ALT
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"; format=flowed



This year, San Francisco will be the international host city for World
Environment Day (June 1st - June 5th). As the United Nation's official "Earth
Day," World Environment Day has been celebrated worldwide since 1972, but this
is the first time that a city in North America has served as host. San
Francisco Mayor Gavin Newsom will be joined by more than 60 mayors from major
cities around the world to participate in five extraordinary days of events
focusing on green cities.

World Environment Day represents a unique opportunity to revitalize our
commitment to protecting our global environment, while learning about exciting
efforts taking place around the world in support of this goal.

NRDC has been actively involved in preparations for World Environment Day and
is organizing a series of special events for online activists like you. Come
hear cutting-edge discussions with NRDC staff and outside experts on some of
the greatest challenges facing the Bay area and cities around the world. 
Take a
tour of our state-of-the-environmental-art office in San Francisco to see the
technologies we now have in place to combat climate change and reduce 
pollution
and waste.

Below is the schedule of NRDC events. Space is extremely limited, so if you 
are
interested in attending any of the workshops or office tours listed, please
email Joyce Yeung at 
<http://by10fd.bay10.hotmail.msn.com/cgi-bin//cgi-bin/compose?curmbox=F000000001&a=57c11ec15dd4610b06975956e53ae8b0&mailto=1&to=biogemsinfo@nrdc.org&msg=MSG1116450128.4&start=4318530&len=4427&src=&type=x>biogemsinfo@nrdc.org 
no later than Monday, May 23rd.

**NRDC Workshops** (reservations required)

Wednesday, June 1, 11:00am:  Global Resources, Cities, and National Security
with Walt Reid, the executive director of the Millennium Ecosystem Assessment,
an unprecedented international scientific assessment on the state of the 
planet.

Thursday, June 2, 2:30pm:  Global Warming Solutions for California, with Dr.
Alan Lloyd, Secretary of the California Environmental Protection Agency.

Friday, June 3, 1:00pm:  Green Ports, with government and citizen experts on
cleaning up marine transport.

Friday, June 3, 5:00pm:  BioGems: Wilderness and Whales, with NRDC 
attorneys on
the frontlines of campaigns to save the Arctic Refuge and other special 
places,
and to protect marine mammals from naval sonar.

**San Francisco Green Office Tours** (reservations required)

Wednesday, June 1, 1:00pm
Thursday, June 2, noon and 1:00pm

Once again, space for all workshops and office tours is extremely limited, so
please email Joyce Yeung at 
<http://by10fd.bay10.hotmail.msn.com/cgi-bin//cgi-bin/compose?curmbox=F000000001&a=57c11ec15dd4610b06975956e53ae8b0&mailto=1&to=biogemsinfo@nrdc.org&msg=MSG1116450128.4&start=4318530&len=4427&src=&type=x>biogemsinfo@nrdc.org 
by May 23rd and let her know
which event(s) you are interested in attending. We will be sure to contact you
with the venue location as well as any further information.

Subject: [sfraves] NRR:  MAPS Updates

--=====================_16228795==.ALT
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="iso-8859-1"; format=flowed
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit

Israeli MDMA/PTSD study begins approval process

Dr. Moshe Kotler, Chair of the Department of Psychiatry at Tel Aviv
University, Sackler School of Medicine, and former chief psychiatrist of the
Israeli Defense Forces, submitted the protocol for our Israeli MDMA-assisted
psychotherapy pilot study to a local ethics committee (called an
Institutional Review Board (IRB) in the US)--the first step in the approval
process.  This study is to take place at Beer Yaakov Mental Health Center
and will administer MDMA to people suffering from treatment-resistant
posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD) related to war or terrorism. Dr. Rael
Strous, psychiatrist at Beer Yaakov Mental Health Center, is coordinating
the protocol review process.

If passed by the local IRB, it will be submitted to a national IRB, an extra
step that does not exist for studies in the US. Once it is passed by the
local and national IRBs it will need to be approved by the Ministry of
Health, the equivalent to the US FDA. The protocol will also be submitted to
the FDA for review, to ensure that the data gathered will be reviewed by FDA
as well as by the Israeli Ministry of Health. We're still months away from
starting the study, but it's looking quite hopeful. MAPS met with
representatives of the Ministry of Health and the Israeli Anti-Drug
Authority during a trip to Israel in March. Officials from both agencies
said they think in principle that the study should take place, with formal
review of the protocol still required.

MAPS-produced psychedelic emergency video on the way

As part of MAPS¹ educational mission, we have created a pilot instructional
video about how to deal with difficult psychedelic experiences, to be shown
as part of a Unitarian Universalist drug education course for young people.
This pilot video was made possible by a grant from the Unitarian
Universalists for Drug Policy Reform (UUDPR). While the target audience for
this video is high school students, it is applicable for anyone who may
encounter people who use psychedelics. The video, which illustrates a party
scene where a young man becomes overwhelmed by his psychedelic experience
and two concerned partygoers step in to help, is being produced by MAPS
staffer Jagdeep Davies, with narration by Rick Doblin. The video was
pilot-tested at one Unitarian congregation and with the feedback received we
will refine the video. When completed, we will reproduce it on DVD and VHS
to distribute from our website to parents, schools, and psychedelic users.
If you are interested in sponsoring the development of the psychedelic
emergency video, please contact: jag@maps.org

Latest MDMA Literature Review posted to our website

MAPS staffer Ilsa Jerome has completed and posted the latest MDMA Literature
Review update <http://www.maps.org/research/mdma/litupdate3> to our website.
It contains papers found between March 2004 and January 2005 and focuses on
issues relevant to estimating the risks and benefits of clinical trials with
MDMA. Sections include clinical trials, studies in ecstasy users and
non-human animal and in-vitro studies. This is the third update to the
comprehensive literature review.

Ilsa writes: ³This year neither clinical trials nor studies in ecstasy users
produced any "novel" results, though several studies in ecstasy users
suggest that psychological problems are more closely associated with drug
use generally, and are not uniquely related to use of any one drug, and more
findings of impaired visual memory in ecstasy users rather than in verbal
memory. Findings from a study and a conference report of ecstasy users in
naturalistic settings are intriguing  as well. This year's crop of non-human
animal studies are where the most interesting findings are, from findings
concerning different measures of serotonin function to findings of long-term
effects in young rats, and a nine-study opus on the neurochemistry behind
immunological changes produced by MDMA.²

You can check out the newest update on the website, with links up on the
MDMA page. You can view it in HTML
(http://www.maps.org/research/mdma/litupdate3) or as a PDF
(http://www.maps.org/research/mdma/protocol/litupdate3.pdf). For those who
want to scroll down through the entire document in HTML without relying on
a navigational bar, we also have a version that allows this
(http://www.maps.org/research/mdma/litupdate3/noframes.html).

Subject: RE: [sfraves] anyone attending STARSCAPE 2005 (east coast)?

I have been to many Starscapes. It is the ONE party in the DC/Bmore area 
that I would go to no matter what the lineup. Lonnie Fisher and Ultraworld 
productions (as well as Scott Henry & Feelgood) have been doing this for 
years. The locale is tight, the ravers come out in droves, and the music is 
almost always on point all around.

I highly recommend it.

Marc(O)
*THWAP!*//Moksha Tribe
DC/MD/VA/CA

Subject: Re: [sfraves] Space Weapons.... the new WMDs

The reality of space based weapons is that they will not be WMDs
unless we put nukes on them. Anything else we can lift into space
will be many orders of magnitude too little energy to be remotely
called a WMD, and I do not think that is what they are talking about
here.

From: "Niels P. Mayer" <npm@mail.netwiz.net>
User-Agent: Mozilla Thunderbird 1.0 (Windows/20041206)
X-Accept-Language: en-us, en
MIME-Version: 1.0
To:  sfraves@hyperreal.org, SCR <scr@socal-raves.org>
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=ISO-8859-1; format=flowed
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: [sfraves] interesting.... DJ SCRATCHING PERFORMANCE TECHNIQUES: ANALYSIS AND
 SYNTHESIS

http://www.speech.kth.se/~hansen/files/HansenBresin_Scratching_Smac03.pdf

DJ SCRATCHING PERFORMANCE TECHNIQUES: ANALYSIS AND SYNTHESIS
Kjetil Falkenberg Hansen and Roberto Bresin
Department of Speech Music and Hearing (TMH)
Royal Institute of Technology (KTH)
{hansen,bresin}@speech.kth.se
ABSTRACT
Scratching is a popular way of making music, turning the DJ into
a musician. Normally scratching is done using a vinyl record, a
turntable and a mixer. Vinyl manipulation is built up by a number
of specialized techniques that have been analysed in a previous
study. The present study has two main objectives. First is to better
understand and model turntable scratching as performed by DJs.
Second is to design a gesture controller for physical sound models,
i.e. models of friction sounds. We attached sensors to a DJ
equipment set-up. Then a DJ was asked to perform typical scratch
gestures both isolated and in a musical context, i.e. as in a real
performance. He also was asked to play with different emotions:
sad, angry, happy and fearful. A model of the techniques used by
the DJ was built based on the analysis of the collected data. The
implementation of the model has been done in pd. The Radio Baton,
with specially adapted gesture controllers, has been used for
controlling the model. The system has been played by professional
DJs in concerts.

---------------------------------------------------------------------
To unsubscribe, e-mail: sfraves-unsubscribe@hyperreal.org
For additional commands, e-mail: sfraves-help@hyperreal.org

Subject: Re: [sfraves] Space Weapons.... the new WMDs

> 
> What's wrong with space-based weapons?
> I can't think of a better place in terms of global reach and resistance to  
> attack...

Isn't our submarine-based nuclear arsenal enough?

We can lob 140 hydrogen bombs onto any point on the planet in 10 minutes.
And thats just from a single submarine.

Submarines are totally hidden from the enemy, nobody knows where they are.

Maybe we should spend that money to balance our budget instead.  

How will space-based weapons help in a war like Iraq?

Once we start putting weapons in space, our enemies will use brute-force
means to destroy them.  The easiest way is simply filling space with an 
orbit of high-speed pellets... a cloud of space junk that will destroy 
anything in orbit.  This could very easily prevent us from ever
putting anything into orbit again.  Essentially locking us on our
planet, ending space exploration for enternity.

Still think space-based weapons are a good idea?

-troy

risks.

 I too skate a bit, i just picked it back up after a roughly 20 year
break.  I never was one to do tricks or anything, just kinda putted
around, and i've found picking it back up, was a little tough at
first, i still can't do any tricks, my legs are too retarded or
something, i can barely ollie still, but i'm working on it.  I havent
been as diligent about getting out and riding, but i plan on getting
back into it shortly, after moving and all that calms down and i got
some time to kill.

i'm gonna make it my new favorite term...hehehe.

Content-Type: text/plain; charset="iso-8859-1"; format=flowed
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit

Forward
Friday May 27th - 1015 Folsom

This month we bring you Ken Ishii from Japan,
Ken Ishii's early infatuation with music arrived via the electronica of 
Yellow Magic Orchestra, Kraftwerk and DAF. It was a fixation he would 
follow until it led him to the work of Derrick May. Impressed and inspired, 
he subsequently immersed himself in what little techno culture and 
recordings made it over to Japan. His Tech-House and Electro Sounds are for 
sure not to be missed.

You can sign for the $10 list @ www.forwardsf.com
The list will be open until 2am!

Main Room:
Ken Ishii (Exceptional / R&S Records / Japan) Best Techno DJ 2004
MRK aka DJ Markie Mark (Wicked / Woosh / Alumni)
Charlotte the Baroness (The EndUp)
Adnan (Forward / Tarantic / Jah Love)

Upstairs:
Hesohi Live Set (Aesoteric / Imperial Dub / Roam Recordings)
Jen? & Garth  Tagteam Seat (Wicked / Grayhound)
Corey Black & Cosmic Jason  Tagteam Seat (Smash Hit Music / Come-Unity)
Rebecca Watkins (Get Underground)

Front Room:
Omar (Fake)
Solar (Pacific Sound)
Adam Warped (Wiskey Pickle)
Nathan (Care Recordings)
Alland Byallo (Nightshift Music / Soul Monkey)

1015 Folsom - San Francisco
10 pm to 6am - 21+ - $15 advance tickets @ www.groovetickets.com
$20 @ the door
More info @ www.forwardsf.com | www.djadnan.com




Moksha Tribe:  www.mokshatribe.org

House Music 101:  http://livingart.com/raving/articles/housemusic101.htm


The US is:  "...a nation of 200 million used-car salesmen with all the 
money we need to buy guns and no qualms about killing anybody else in the 
world who tries to make us uncomfortable."
-Hunter S. Thompson

"It would have been quite impossible for us to develop our plan for the 
world if we had been subjected to the lights of publicity during those 
years. But, the world is more sophisticated and prepared to march towards a 
world government. The supranational sovereignty of an intellectual elite 
and world bankers is surely preferable to the national autodetermination 
practiced in past centuries ..."
- David Rockefeller, Bilderberg club permanent member, 1991

"Music is prophecy, its style and economic organization are ahead of the 
rest of society. It makes audible the new world that will gradually become 
visible."
-Jacques Attali in his seminal text "Noise"



--=====================_9649024==.ALT--

Subject: [sfraves] BSP: Hugger-Mugger 5/24/05 - BREAKIN' THAT @SS!!

Looks like the breaks will be rockin' @ the infamous Hugger Mugger this 
upcoming Tuesday night folks! Come on down and shimmy that tuchus with us 
whilst we attempt to warm up your week!

Lineup (thus far):

Marc(O) (*THWAP!*//Moksha Tribe - DC/CA)
Calamity Jane (Moksha Tribe)
Li (viberation/tech-on)


H U G G E R - M U G G E R  is @   Lit Lounge

***Every Tuesday of the month.***

Lit Lounge is located at 101 6th St. at Mission, in San Francisco.
Admission is Free so there is NO excuse!
This is a 21 and over event.
We serve pumpin' tunes from 9pm to 2am.
And remember happy hour is from 9pm to 10pm so get there early!


Resident DJs:
Juan Segovia (tech-on)
Andy W (viberation/refined music/tech-on)
Clairity (teknotika sf/theta records/tech-on)
Forest Green (sister sf/cloud factory/tech-on)
Li (viberation/tech-on)
Shazbot (moksha tribe/tech-on)


ez.
Marc(O)

Subject: [sfraves] BSP: Tonight, Digga Beat III...

What's up y'all, tonight I'll be playin' at Digga Beat 3 at 10PM.  Y'all 
should stop by and dance with us.  The rest of the info is below.

See ya there,
Joey Frisco (DTS, Nocturnalism Ent.)

==========================================================
***Update: 5th room added... check timeslots below for more info.


Digga Beat III

Room 1

E.N.D (Goodfellaz Crew, Pitched Up Recordings, Happyhardcore.com- Toronto, 
Canada)
Coming from Totonto, E.N.D is one of the most clever dj's to grace the 
decks. His style is not only unique but unmatched by any other dj in 
Toronto. In 2002 he hooked up with the Goodfellaz and has never looked back. 
E.N.D. has been riping up crowds not only as a DJ but as one of the top 
featured MC's on the east coast. As you would any of the Pitched up Crew 
expect nothing else but the best from this sure crowd pleaser.
No Left Turn & Joshua (LiquidVinyl/KFA)
GO-ZANIA (HCFTP)
MollyMush (HCFTP/RAVE N' BEATS USA)
SideShow (HCFTP/DTS)
Hi-C (NU VISION)
Dj Elixir (NU VISION/ djelixir.com

Room 2

Pistachio vs. Anonymous (www.djpistachio.com)
Back in 1999 these two dj's tore up dance floors all over CA. After the end 
of HomeBase and Second and Jacson these two dj's fell off the radar. It's 
been allmost 4 years since we have had the pleasure of seeing these two 
artists perform. Welcome back two of the best dj's in the bay area trance 
scene! The return of Pistachio & Anonymous!
Michael Liu (Illumination Records)
The Doctor w/ MC Fader (DTS/BR Prod/Liquidvinyldjs/Rhythm Method)
Reclipse (DTS/Br Prod)
Joey Frisco (DTS)

Room 3 (Hosted by SecondBase)

Cynikal (HCFTP/LA)
SecondBase (HCFTP/EVO)
R-Type (5lowershop / low viz)
H-Rock (Distorted Trauma / NBR)
Elektroholic (Distorted Trauma / NBR)
Ballistic Ali (Distorted Trauma / NBR)

Room 4 (Hosted by Wavelength)

Dragnfly(djdragnfly.com)
Majere (Elektrosorcery)
Epsilon (Preserve)
Thomas Kent (Ill Behavior, Modified)
Wavelength (Oneiromancy, D&A Music )

$10 Presale $15 @ the Door
We will also be celebrating Mateas B-day :)

Info @ (408) 380-1206


Timeslots:

Room 1
10-11:Elixir
11-12 GO-ZANIA
12-1 No Left Turn vs Joshua
1-2 E.N.D.
2-3 MollyMush vs. Valerie Sparks
3-4 sideshow

Room 2
10-11: Joey Frisco
11-12: The Doctor w/ MC Fader
12-1: Reclipse
1-2:Michael Liu
2-4: Pistachio vs. Anonymous

Room 3
10-11 Ballistic Ali
11-12 Elektroholic
12-1 Cynikal
1-2 Second Base
2-3 R-Type
3-4 H-Rock

Room 4
10-11: Wavelength
11-12: Epsilon
12-2: Dragnfly
2-3: Majere
3-4: Thomas Kent

Room 5
10-11: Rye Bread
11-12: Hi-C
12-1: Dj 2QT
1-2: Dj Saiyan
Dj Mook 2-3
Furry vs Dingo 3-4

Subject: [sfraves] political spam - Tell your friends: Please sign emergency

If the far right (not the Bush admin; they are the point man for all of 
this) gets ahold of the courts,
I am afraid it will be the beginning of the end.  I don't usually send spam 
like this out, but this is important
enough I feel.  It's not very easy to roll back changes in the law (only 
now has a 1779 law banning American Indians
from the city of Boston been repealed) and the law, or rather the thought 
and view of reality behind the law, shapes
society and how it operates.

But then again, when 1/4 or 1/3 of high school seniors think the government 
has some right in banning free speech....
the changes happening in society may already be taking hold....

<sigh>

doug


Hi!

I just signed MoveOn PAC's emergency petition to stop the "nuclear option" 
the far right wing's plan to seize absolute power to stack our courts - and 
I hope you will sign too.

Starting Monday, the petition will be delivered straight to Congress every 
three hours until the final vote, and many of our comments will be read 
aloud on the Senate floor.

Please find out more and sign right now at:

http://www.moveonpac.org/nuclear

Thanks!

Subject: [sfraves] Thank you for the music while on the road & elsewhere

--NextPart_Webmail_9m3u9jl4l_861_1116815824_0
Content-Type: text/plain
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit

Hi SFravers,
I am sorry that I missed the 5-year anniversary party, but I am writing to everyone (especially the DJs) to thank you for the music (short list follows). If your name is on this list, rest assured that your sounds have been playing around various campfires in the US West. I even had fun brandishing some glowsticks while chillin' to this music.

I have been on a memorable journey and now I re-subscribed to say a few words. More on that later. Don't worry, I won't exceed my posting limit per day.

For now, I must say that while traveling I have enjoyed ALL of the music captured on hand-burned and commercially-produced CDs by artists such as:

AC Slater (60 Minutes of Uplifting Happy Hardcore)
Alex Van Dune (FIX)
Amber (CityDweller: Acid Trance Lives Underground)
Andrew Phelan (1984: Chapter 2, San Francisco)
Andy W 
the Candle (In a Dark Place)
Canton (Live @ the creamery Pt II 12/2/2000, Oakland CA)
Denise (theundergroundurbansound)
DJ Andy M (Lavarat--Progressive Psychedelia/Psytrance)
DJ Burn (Salvador, 10/2001)
DJ Cantos (Cantos)
DJ Jack Triumph (progression)
DJ Kir Kryyn (Beyond Good and Evil)
DJ Fuckwork (Phase 1: Live at Ascension)
DJ Mollymush (Here I Go & Summer Lovin')
DJ Tsar (Untold)
Doc Martin (fabric 10)
Ganymede (Harvesting the Space Lotus)
Hypnomatic
Jonah (Jonah presents Temple of the Drums)
Justin Hale (3 weeks)
Kevin James (Acid Reflex)
MC Boomerang (Jan '04 Rap & DJ Overdubs)
No Left Turn (Bad Reception 2)
Shawn Allen (DUBTECH)
ShezTek (Hit Me, Beat Me, Break Me)

If I missed you, forgive me because I still have a lot of stuff in storage. I am so thankful for the variety of EDM. Whatever happens, the music will never leave me.

greg
--NextPart_Webmail_9m3u9jl4l_861_1116815824_0--

Subject: Re: [sfraves] political spam - Tell your friends: Please sign emergency petition to save our courts

personally, I believe that taking the government from one corrupt
group, and giving it to one that's just as equally corrupt, solves
nothing, in the long run.

Instead, Perhaps we should fix our broken system, supported and
created by both democrats, and republicans, than bitching about one
side or another.

Irony in this situation, is that the groups with the most tax breaks,
are those in the salary range of senators, house members, and other
politicians.

No matter who you vote into office,no matter what party is in control,
no matter what laws you lobby for, or what you try to change,
understand that the system is still broken.

Democrat or republican, their ultimate goals are still to stay on top.

X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: Re: [sfraves] WW3

On 5/19/05, Rikki Everett <demanufactured@hotmail.com> wrote:
>=20
>=20
> Ahhh, but WW3 has such potential. Think of all the fun we'd have....

WW3.

WW3 will start in China -- not the Middle East. Japan has been
forbidden by international law to build weapons ever since WW2 but
China will obtain more military power after the US invades Korea.
China will successfully invade Taiwan, and US-occupied Korea will not
be able to stop them. At this point, the prohibition on Japanese
weapons manufacture will end. This'll be about 2010, 2015. The
Americans will initiate it, thinking they can use the Japanese to
control China, and in the end they will sorely regret it.

The Japanese will nearly instantaneously adapt their robotics
technologies to military purposes. Not only will mecha armor suits be
a reality, they'll also make giant robot dragons. These giant robot
dragons will be completely unnecessary, tactically speaking, because
in practical terms they'll have the same functionality as helicopters,
but the Japanese will build them anyway. (Count on it.)

The psychological effect will be absolutely terrifying. The war will
begin when Japan invades China. Japan will not make significant
inroads in China, and will not be able to control the territory it
claims -- if island nations could take over continental empires
effectively, both the British and the Japanese would have done it many
many times, but the very idea is absolutely ludicrous -- but the
Japanese will do it anyway. Their real goal will be to get far enough
inland for their dragons to attack Chinese who don't realize that the
dragons are robots. The psychological effect, again, will be
absolutely terrifying, more so in this case. This will in fact be the
entire purpose of World War 3 -- terrifying ignorant Chinese peasants
-- but only the ruling classes of China and Japan will realize this,
and neither of those groups of people will admit it.

Unfortunately, the rest of the world will believe the Japanese to have
turned into completely insane, murderous lunatics, and all sorts of
hell will break loose. What's really interesting about this war is
that it may be the first "World War" where the Americans enter the
fray too soon, and also the first where they lose. America's goal will
be to prevent the conflict from spiralling out of hand, but in their
excessive desire for power and control, they'll mistake a border
skirmish in an aeons-old rivalry for a serious act of war, primarily
because of all the dragons setting peasants on fire, which, when it
appears on CNN for the first time, will pretty much be enough to get
anybody worked up. (Also, the President will be another Bush, and
entering wars impetuously to distract the people from bad economic
policy at home is already a tradition in that dynasty.)

Entering Asia in military force, the Americans will leave their
occupied territories unprotected. Never imagining how much more
important self-rule is to the Arab peoples than material wealth,
they'll attempt to set up the usual puppet governments, but the minute
American military resources are focused on Asia, those puppet
governments will topple. Arabs will set oil fields on fire from
Afghanistan to Egypt, and between that and the robot dragons, the
Americans will think the whole world has gone insane. Violent
opposition to American corporations and puppet governments serving
American interests will also erupt in Central and South America,
particularly in Argentina and Colombia, to a large extent inspired by
the ferocity of the Arabs. In Argentina the government will collapse
completely; in Colombia the cocaine cartels will declare their leader
king and demand recognition in the United Nations.

At this point the Americans will resort to the bomb. They will say
it's the second time they've had to use the bomb on the Japanese, and
that it's the Japanese's fault. What they won't anticipate will be the
Japanese response.

Soon after, the moon is destroyed, and that's when things get really
out of hand. The Zeta Reticulans retaliate in 2032, and Trogdor is
first seen on Earth in 2035.


--=20
Giles Soundwave =3D Giles Goat Boy
http://www.gilesgoatboy.org/cats_cradle/

turned into completely insane, murderous lunatics, and all sorts of
hell will break loose. What's really interesting about this war is
that it may be the first "World War" where the Americans enter the
fray too soon, and also the first where they lose. America's goal will
be to prevent the conflict from spiralling out of hand, but in their
excessive desire for power and control, they'll mistake a border
skirmish in an aeons-old rivalry for a serious act of war, primarily
because of all the dragons setting peasants on fire, which, when it
appears on CNN for the first time, will pretty much be enough to get
anybody worked up. (Also, the President will be another Bush, and
entering wars impetuously to distract the people from bad economic
policy at home is already a tradition in that dynasty.)

Entering Asia in military force, the Americans will leave their
occupied territories unprotected. Never imagining how much more
important self-rule is to the Arab peoples than material wealth,
they'll attempt to set up the usual puppet governments, but the minute
American military resources are focused on Asia, those puppet
governments will topple. Arabs will set oil fields on fire from
Afghanistan to Egypt, and between that and the robot dragons, the
Americans will think the whole world has gone insane. Violent
opposition to American corporations and puppet governments serving
American interests will also erupt in Central and South America,
particularly in Argentina and Colombia, to a large extent inspired by
the ferocity of the Arabs. In Argentina the government will collapse
completely; in Colombia the cocaine cartels will declare their leader
king and demand recognition in the United Nations.

At this point the Americans will resort to the bomb. They will say
it's the second time they've had to use the bomb on the Japanese, and
that it's the Japanese's fault. What they won't anticipate will be the
Japanese response.

Soon after, the moon is destroyed, and that's when things get really
out of hand. The Zeta Reticulans retaliate in 2032, and Trogdor is
first seen on Earth in 2035.


-- 
Giles Soundwave = Giles Goat Boy
http://www.gilesgoatboy.org/cats_cradle/

Giles Soundwave <dj.soundwave@gmail.com> wrote:
On 5/19/05, Rikki Everett wrote:
> 
> 
> Ahhh, but WW3 has such potential. Think of all the fun we'd have....

WW3.

WW3 will start in China -- not the Middle East. Japan has been
forbidden by international law to build weapons ever since WW2 but
China will obtain more military power after the US invades Korea.
China will successfully invade Taiwan, and US-occupied Korea will not
be able to stop them. At this point, the prohibition on Japanese
weapons manufacture will end. This'll be about 2010, 2015. The
Americans will initiate it, thinking they can use the Japanese to
control China, and in the end they will sorely regret it.

The Japanese will nearly instantaneously adapt their robotics
technologies to military purposes. Not only will mecha armor suits be
a reality, they'll also make giant robot dragons. These giant robot
dragons will be completely unnecessary, tactically speaking, because
in practical terms they'll have the same functionality as helicopters,
but the Japanese will build them anyway. (Count on it.)

The psychological effect will be absolutely terrifying. The war will
begin when Japan invades China. Japan will not make significant
inroads in China, and will not be able to control the territory it
claims -- if island nations could take over continental empires
effectively, both the British and the Japanese would have done it many
many times, but the very idea is absolutely ludicrous -- but the
Japanese will do it anyway. Their real goal will be to get far enough
inland for their dragons to attack Chinese who don't realize that the
dragons are robots. The psychological effect, again, will be
absolutely terrifying, more so in this case. This will in fact be the
entire purpose of World War 3 -- terrifying ignorant Chinese peasants
-- but only the ruling classes of China and Japan will realize this,
and neither of those groups of people will admit it.

Unfortunately, the rest of the world will believe the Japanese to have
turned into completely insane, murderous lunatics, and all sorts of
hell will break loose. What's really interesting about this war is
that it may be the first "World War" where the Americans enter the
fray too soon, and also the first where they lose. America's goal will
be to prevent the conflict from spiralling out of hand, but in their
excessive desire for power and control, they'll mistake a border
skirmish in an aeons-old rivalry for a serious act of war, primarily
because of all the dragons setting peasants on fire, which, when it
appears on CNN for the first time, will pretty much be enough to get
anybody worked up. (Also, the President will be another Bush, and
entering wars impetuously to distract the people from bad economic
policy at home is already a tradition in that dynasty.)

Entering Asia in military force, the Americans will leave their
occupied territories unprotected. Never imagining how much more
important self-rule is to the Arab peoples than material wealth,
they'll attempt to set up the usual puppet governments, but the minute
American military resources are focused on Asia, those puppet
governments will topple. Arabs will set oil fields on fire from
Afghanistan to Egypt, and between that and the robot dragons, the
Americans will think the whole world has gone insane. Violent
opposition to American corporations and puppet governments serving
American interests will also erupt in Central and South America,
particularly in Argentina and Colombia, to a large extent inspired by
the ferocity of the Arabs. In Argentina the government will collapse
completely; in Colombia the cocaine cartels will declare their leader
king and demand recognition in the United Nations.

At this point the Americans will resort to the bomb. They will say
it's the second time they've had to use the bomb on the Japanese, and
that it's the Japanese's fault. What they won't anticipate will be the
Japanese response.

Soon after, the moon is destroyed, and that's when things get really
out of hand. The Zeta Reticulans retaliate in 2032, and Trogdor is
first seen on Earth in 2035.


-- 
Giles Soundwave = Giles Goat Boy
http://www.gilesgoatboy.org/cats_cradle/

Hi everyone. It's time for another monthly installment of Secret Psychedeli=

cally, things have changed up for tonight. We'll still have psychedelic tra=
nce brought to you by local heroes, Obu, Epsilon, Pikasso, and Michael Liu,=

 an original Secret Society member will be in the house. (Here's a little e=
xplaination - Secret Psychedelica was born from a multi-genre weekly called=
 Secret Society. There were about five people putting it all together but w=
e had since ended the weekly and only Secret Psychedelica, the psytrance th=
emed night, kept going.) Tonight, we'll be welcoming home Secret Society's =
original tech-house resident, Gabriel Black, and his awesome Summit Soundsy=
stem. And not a moment to soon as our special guest for tonight is Breakbea=
t Science DJ and Rockstar Energy drink spokesmodel, Reid Speed. The combine=
d forces of her mixing skills and track selection as well as the crystal cl=
ean Summit Soundsystem are sure make a big impact in the halls Secret Psych=
edelica... -michael

SECRET BREAKEDELICA v5.5
4th Monday of every month

Monday, May 23rd, 2005
version five.five:

Oops...normally, the Secret Psychedelica anniversary party is held in May. =
However, due to current international travel regulations, our intended gues=
t will not be able to enter the US for this show. But, do not fret, we are =
currently working on re-scheduling the anniversary show for this summer. So=
, for one night, and one night only, Secret Psychedelica breaks down and mo=
ves into the backroom. And, as a special treat for v5.5, Secret Psychedelic=
a welcomes Breakbeat Science DJ, Reid Speed. Known for her powerful d&b set=
s, Reid Speed ventures into the breaks arena on her current string of DJ ap=
pearances. Be prepared when her murderous mix of breakbeat and electro rips=
 through the dancefloor of the Savoy.

Subject: [sfraves] BSP: Live Mix from Future (Electrotech/clash/techno)

Greets,

I just want to get the word out about Future (www.futuresf.com) a new club 
night featuring electrotech/clash, synthpop, future pop.. The opening night 
was quite fun and I recorded my live mix from the evening and you can find 
it at the link below.. Some new tunes that I believe this scene might be 
interested in hearing:
http://www.egregious.net/comps/live_mix_5_19_05/

Do check out the club when it occurs next.. :) I'm also gathering that this 
mix will interest a lot more people on this list than say my more favored 
hard techno / powernoise interests. So, post your comments.. I'd like to 
hear them as I usually receive silence (on the dance floor unfortunately 
and off) when I'm doing hard techno.

Subject: [sfraves] The Great God Om, otherwise known as Lucky


So this isn't music related in any way shape or form, but yesterday I came 
across a turtle in the middle of the road, and no one in any of the houses 
on that street claimed him. As far as I can tell he's a land turtle w/ a 
nasty disposition. Does anyone have any hints on what to do with him? So far 
he's resigned himself to giving me evil glares ( I didn't know turtles could 
do that) from inside an aquarium.

Subject: Re: [sfraves] Secret Psychedelica v5.5>Monday, May 23rd (fwd)

This was awesome!

Reid Speed took a copy of my record! Although I don't know if she'll
ever actually listen to it. And whoever said she was cute was not
lying at all. She's like Bubbles with headphones! She does the New
York head-askew thing, it's like this kind of obnoxious gesture, but
when she does it, it's **demure**. I never in a million years would
have imagined it was even possible to do that gesture demurely. She
smiles like an angel, I want to put her in an evening dress with
ruffles and buy her diamonds and a trained swan.

And Terry let me pilot the mighty Viberation Graphics armada. Jesus,
what a night out! Actually it'd be more truthful to say that Terry
showed me how to push three buttons and then he ran away and hid
somewhere. I'm not even kidding, I scanned the entire room several
times, Inspector Gadget couldn't have found him. So I was sort of
like...uh...well I'll push those three buttons **really**
**quickly!!** Like -- to the beat!

That was like the most amazing night out I've had all year.

It might actually be the only night out I've had all year. Hmm.

Anyway. Wow.

Saw Li, and Alex, who I haven't seen in years, and finally officially
met Aaron Jae, and saw Scott Scosol, whose real name I forgot (sorry!)
and met some people, and then I was like "hey Reid Speed here's a
record" and she was like "is it breaks?" and I was like "uh..."

God that was awesome. Except I wish I'd given her a better record. I
need to make more records now. Which means I have to get a job. FUCK!

Oh well.

Anyway yeah that hella rocked.

Subject: [sfraves] [NRR] Gear for Sale

Hey everyone, I just wanted to post this out to all of you first.

I have some DJ Equipment that I want to get rid of.

1 - DJ Coffin (holds 19" mixer) and Stand
1 - Cerwin Vega 12" Monitor and Stand
(http://store.salestores.com/cevev1122way.html) a few years old, but
rarely ever used.
1 - 1.5 ft. Single Bulb Black Light
1 - 4 ft. Dual Bulb Black Light
1 - Red DJ Spot light
1 - Strobe light
1 - QSC PLX-2402 Amp
(http://www.qscaudio.com/products/amps/plx/plx.htm) Been used at a lot
of parties, but still works.  The left channel cut out on it once, but
i tapped the amp and it came back and hasn't had a problem since.

I don't want this in my house anymore, so first person with cash takes
the whole shebang...she bang...she bang...oh god why did i get that
going in my head again....

I'll let it all go for $200, OBO.

Subject: [sfraves] BSP: Dave Aude + Terry Mullan @ Mighty - Sat June 3rd

PURE
SATURDAY JUNE 3RD, 2005

::ROOM1-HOUSE
------

DAVE AUDE (daveaude.com / subliminal / moonshine - LA)
---
Dave Aude is one hell of a dj/procuder. Who do Djs like Dj Dan,
Christopher Lawrence, Donald Glaude, & Keoki turn to to help them come
correct when producing thier songs? DAVE AUDE, producer/dj
extraordinare, remixing for the artists like Madonna, and producing on
album for musicians like Sting, Aude is a huge force in electronice
music, and his Dj sets refelect it! Come watch him tear the roof off
club Mighty!!

TERRY MULLAN (terrymullan.com / catalyst / kontrast / eam / moonshine
/ colourz - Chicago) *PURE resident!
---
Terry Mullan is a house music legend headling the world for over 10
years. Playing all the huge SF festivals like Skills, Planet New Year,
Atlantis, ect and playing all these types of festivals worldwide along
with making huge hit tracks and remixes for artists like Dj Dan have
made him one of america's favorite djs. Come watch the Acid master as
he slams the dancefloors like only he can!!

along w/

FILTER FREQ (filterfreq.com / kontrast / in-stereo / ammo / phat & phunkie =
- SF)
SERG ROCKWELL (colourz / rockrite - SF)
MIGUEL MALDONADO (colourz - SF)

Subject: [sfraves] Future Breaks fm! - download 5/14 - DJ M & Mikebee

Couple bits of audio from the Saturday before last...
enjoy!  Dave


Future Breaks fm!
Every Saturday from 4-6pm PST
KUSF 90.3FM, San Francisco
With your host dj PUSH and special guests
D&B - Breaks - Tech House - Grime - Hip-Hop - Broken
Beat - & much more!
Website: http://www.futurebreaks.fm
(redesign & podcast coming soon)


5/14/2005 - Mikebee & DJ M

Download Part 1 - Mikebee (192kbps mp3)
http://www.flux.fm/~mikebee/audio/mikebee%20-%20live%20on%20future%20breaks%20fm%205-14-05.mp3

Download Part 2 - DJ M (96kbps AAC)
http://futurebreaks.fm/music/FBFM-20050514-Pt2-DJ_M-96k.m4a


TRACKLISTS ::

MIKEBEE
Tech House
1. My My - Klatta (Playhouse)
2. Trentemoller - Physical Fraction (Audiomatique)

10. DJ T - Rising (Get Physical)

[Faultline- http://faultlinednb.com]

12. Random Movement Struggle to the Grave
(Bassbin-CDR)

14. Electrosoul System Rain (Strictly Digital)
